intro: Stephania pierrei, commonly known as the mountain beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that contain seeds with tufted hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in shaded, moist habitats and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
